# Tender Notice
### Project Title
Little Detroit Canadian Coast Guard Site - Helicopter Pad, Tower Demolition, and Replacement Phase Two
### Solicitation Number
WS4245544404
### Closing Date
January 16, 2024, at 2:00 PM EST

### Description
A request for proposal (RFP) has been issued by the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) on behalf of the Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) for the construction of a helicopter pad and the demolition and replacement of an Aid to Navigation (AtoN) Tower at the CCG's LL1013 Little Detroit Site, located on the North East point of Aird Island on Lake Superior.

### Scope of Work
The Contractor will be responsible for the construction of a wooden helicopter pad and the demolition and replacement of the AtoN Tower. The project specifications and drawings are included in the RFP package.

### Timeline
The Contractor is expected to complete the Work in its entirety by June 28th, 2024.

### Evaluation Criteria
The selection criteria will include variations or combinations of the following methods:
* Respondent qualifications and experience
* Reasonableness of the bid price
* Overall value to the Crown

### Trade Agreements
The procurement is subject to the following trade agreements:
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

### Contact Information
For more information, please contact Jeffrey Cooper, Procurement Advisor,  SPAC/PSPC, at jeffrey.cooper@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.
